meanings.definition: A person who makes mistakes or errors.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is known as the king of screwups in our class.
meanings.sent2: The boss always blames the screwups on the new employees.
meanings.sent3: The screwups in the comedy show had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her life was a series of screwups, like a broken clock that couldn't tell time.
meanings.sent5: The image of a screwups is like a colorful painting that never quite dries.

meanings.definition: The act of making a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: The team's screwups cost them the championship title.
meanings.sent2: We all learn from our screwups and become better because of them.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was a mess after the baking screwups of the kids.
meanings.sent4: His speech was full of screwups, like a car with a flat tire trying to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the concept of screwups to teach the importance of attention to detail.
